dialogues.text: A pause. The phone rings. REGGIE answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOBIE holds the receiver in his metal hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lampert? -- it's me -- the man  who was in your room a few minutes  ago --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering the receiver) The man you had the fight with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Is Dyle with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) The man who hit me, lady -- Dyle --  that's his name. What's wrong -- is  he still there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE's back is turned to PETER so he can't see her face He watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Yes -- that's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Reggie -- what's he  saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Don't trust him -- don't tell him  anything. He's after the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, REGGIE lowers the 'phone from her ear and hangs i up.  She hesitates a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He -- he said if I didn't give the  money, he'll kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't take that too seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe what he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're only trying to scare you,  that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know what they're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't -- but as long as they think  you have the money, or know where it  is, or have it without knowing where  it is, or don't even know you have  it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mustn't let what he said bother  you. It was only words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Words can hurt very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause) Go to sleep -- I'll see you in the  morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't put yourself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- I'm on your side. Remember  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'll remember. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts out, pausing by the door and examining the hole SCOBIE made in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you'll take my advice -- (smiling) You'll undress in the closet. Oh,  and if you need me, just bang on the  wall. I'll be next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As PETER (now called DYLE) leaves REGGIE's room and close the door. He pauses for a moment, listening, hears nothin then bends down and starts pulling at a loose thread in o of his socks. As usual, the thread unravels -- and unrave and unravels some more until it seems that the entire soc has come unknit. Now, taking the long thread, he bends do near the door and, taking his tie-pin, attaches one end o the thread to the bottom of REGGIE's door. He then runs t thread along the floor to his door (next door) and works underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As DYLE enters, the thread in his hand. He goes to a near table where he attaches the thread to the heavy room key, which he then balances on the extreme edge of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) -- But I am calm, Mr. Bartholomew --  what I called to tell you was there's  someone else -- someone who wasn't  in that photograph you showed me. He  says his name is Peter Joshua -- but  it isn't -- it's Dyle. (a pause) Mr. Bartholomew? -- are you still  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTHOLOMEW on the phone. He is silent for a moment, his  face troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who this Mr. Dyle is,  but it's just possible we were wrong  about who killed your husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) You mean he might have -- Mr.  Bartholomew, I'm catching the next  plane out of here -- I'm not going  to sit here and wait for someone to  make chopped liver out of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Where are you now -- can you meet  me? Do you know Les Halles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Yes, where? (a pause) -- in fifteen minutes. I'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE hangs up the phone, picks up her bag, checks her h in the mirror, then starts for the door. She stops as she notices the connecting door leading to the room next door DYLE's room. She goes to it, silently slips out the key a bends to peer through the keyhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE is removing his coat. Before he lays it over a chair he takes a gun from the inside pocket, checks it, and tuc it into his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE reacts in surprise and fright, jumps quickly away  from the door. She hurries to the door leading to the hal and reaches for the knob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT -- ROOM KEY. The thread attached to it is pull (by the action of REGGIE's door opening) and the key fall to the floor with a clatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including DYLE as he reacts, his head wheeling to look at the key. Snatching his coat, he runs for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE sneaks past DYLE's door. When she has passed, t door opens and DYLE appears. REGGIE takes off on the run, turning the corner and starting down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is deserted, except for the sleeping NIGHT PORTER, as  REGGIE comes running down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, looking back towards the sound of his voice, b does not slacken her speed. She runs out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE runs out. She looks up the street, sees a TAXI hails it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taxi -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It pulls over to the curb. Looking once more over her sho she takes a bill out of her pocket, opens the cab door, s it loudly without getting in and hands the bill to the dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N'importe oГ№ -- vite! Allez-y!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jumps back into the shadows of a nearby doorway as th TAXI pulls away. At the same time DYLE runs out of the ho Another TAXI is coming down the street. DYLE hails it  frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taxi -- ! Taxi -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It pulls up and DYLE opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Follow that taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taxi! Follow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Je ne comprends rien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desperately, DYLE reaches into his coat pocket and pulls a small dictionary and begins flipping through the pages.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: In the shadows. She lifts her eyes in annoyance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finding the word) Suivre -- el taxi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! Oui, Monsieur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE comes out of the shadows, looks after DYLE's taxi, then hails another one which pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to DRIVER) Aux Halles -- vite!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE and BARTHOLOMEW walking. The Central Market is tee with activity -- trucks creeping around other trucks, cas of fruit and vegetables stacked on every inch of sidewalk WORKERS of all types milling around, unloading trucks and stacking crates, little electric carts scooting in and ou and nearby, one of the huge, high-roofed sheds where the  butchers work.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE AND BARTHOLOMEW
dialogues.text: CAMERA LEADING them as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Incredible, isn't it? Zola called it  'le ventre de Paris' -- the womb of  Paris, the belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a banana from a nearby stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peeling it) What did you want to see me about,  Mr. Bartholomew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaves a coin on the  crate) Were you followed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but I lost him. I really did it  quite brilliantly. I'm beginning to  think women make the best spies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a gun, Mr. Bartholomew -- I  saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dyle, or whatever his name is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does your Mr. Dyle look like,  Mrs. Lampert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hardly my Mr. Dyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Describe him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- he's tall -- over six feet --  rather thin -- in good physical shape,  I'd say -- dark eyes -- quite  handsome, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not Carson Dyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping) Carson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one Dyle connected with  this affair, Mrs. Lampert -- that's  Carson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you've known about him all  along? Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTHOLOMEW looks at her for a moment, then glances aroun his attention is drawn inside the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's enough to make you a vegetarian,  isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost as far as the eye can see, row upon row of beef si hung on hooks.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE AND BARTHOLOMEW, (TRAVELING)
dialogues.text: As REGGIE looks at the hanging beef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just lucky that I'm not hanging  next to one of those things right  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shudders, throws away her banana and turns back to  BARTHOLOMEW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bartholomew -- why didn't you  tell me you knew about Dyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't see any point. Dyle's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead? Mr. Bartholomew -- maybe you'd  better tell me what this thing's all  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lined up at a zinc bar are several BUTCHERS, their white  smocks stained with blood. REGGIE and BARTHOLOMEW sit at table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose you're old enough to have  heard of World War Two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barely, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 1944, five members of the O.S.S. --  the military espionage unit -- were  ordered behind the German lines for  the purpose of delivering $250,000  in gold to the French Underground.  The five men --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITER arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vous dГ©sirez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) They always do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the WAITER) CafГ©.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GratinГ©e, choucroute garnie, salade  de pommes -- et un ballon de rouge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lampert, I really hadn't planned  on spending the entire night here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I at least keep the onion soup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTHOLOMEW shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the WAITER) La soupe tout simplement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITER nods and goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously) Go on, please -- five men -- $250,000 --  the French Underground --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The five men. They were, of  course, your husband, Charles, the  three men who showed up at his funeral  yesterday, and Carson Dyle. But  something went wrong and they were  unable to locate their contact. It  must have been at that point that  they decided to steal the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steal it how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By burying it, and then reporting  that the Germans had captured it.   All they had to do was come back  after the war, dig it up and split  it five ways -- a quarter of a million  dollars with no questions asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fascinated) May I have a cigarette, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTHOLOMEW pulls out a package and she takes one, looks it and rips off the filter tip. He winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate these things -- it's like  drinking coffee through a veil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the other end in her mouth, then picks up the ma and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything went smoothly enough until  after the gold was buried -- then,  before they could get out, they were  ambushed by a German patrol. A machine  gun separated Scobie from his right  hand -- and caught Carson Dyle full  in the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE takes another cigarette from his pack, rips off th filter (he winces again) and puts it into her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with that one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to the cigarette she just lit, still practicall brand-new in the ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Nothing, I guess. What happened  then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands over the newer one to BARTHOLOMEW, who sadly  examines its mutilated end while REGGIE returns to the fi cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you any idea what these things  cost over here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please go on, Mr. Bartholomew --  what happened then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scobie was able to travel, but Carson  Dyle was clearly dying, so they --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITER returns with the coffee and onion soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: La soupe, c'est pour qui?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pour moi. Go on, Mr. Bartholomew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITER puts down the cup and bowl and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson was dying so they were forced  to leave him. They finally got back  to the base, made their report, and  waited for the war to end. Only  Charles couldn't wait quite as long  as the others. He beat them back to  the gold, took everything for himself  and disappeared. It's taken Gideon,  Tex and Scobie all this time to catch  up with him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if they stole all that money --  why can't you arrest them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know what happened from the bits  and pieces we were able to paste  together -- but we still have no  proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what has all this got to do with  the C.I.O.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.I.A., Mrs. Lampert. We're an  extension of the wartime O.S.S. It  was our money and we want it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Bartholomew, but  nothing you've told me has changed  my mind. I still intend leaving Paris --  tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't advise that, Mrs. Lampert.   You'd better consider what happened  to your husband when he tried to  leave. Those men won't be very far  away -- no matter where you go. In  fact, I don't even see any point in  your changing hotels. Please help  us, Mrs. Lampert. Your government is  counting on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if I'm going to die, I might  as well do it for my country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, stop it. What do you want me to  do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're anxious to know who this man  is -- the one calling himself Dyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he really is Dyle. He could  still be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mrs. Lampert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But no one actually saw him die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mrs. Lampert. His death is  registered with the War Department  in Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Then who's this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -- but I think you'd  better find out, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in an ideal position -- he  trusts you. (grinning) Besides, you said yourself, women  make the best spies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned) Agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE leaves the hotel and turns into the Place. A moment  later, REGGIE comes cautiously from the hotel. As she wat DYLE, a SANDWICH-MAN advertising a driving school passes hotel. REGGIE falls in behind him, his tall placard hidin her from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First comes DYLE, passing a sidewalk cafe on the corner,  then the SANDWICH-MAN and REGGIE. The SANDWICH-MAN turns  off, leaving REGGIE out in the open. A moment later, DYLE passes a GIRL painting a canvas, her easel set up in the  middle of the sidewalk. He stops when he has passed her a turns to look at her work. REGGIE, not knowing what to do and afraid she will be seen by DYLE, who is now looking h way, spins and sits at the sidewalk cafe's nearest table, her back to DYLE. It is already occupied by a middle-aged TOURIST.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE AND TOURIST
dialogues.text: The TOURIST, complete with camera, beret and guide book,  looks up from his coffee, surprised. He stares at REGGIE she stares back. Finally, not knowing what else to do, sh smiles, then takes a portion of his brioche and eats it. He smiles back emptily, not knowing what to make of her. REGGIE turns to look at DYLE.

dialogues.speaker: DYLE
dialogues.text: He has made his judgment of the painting and now moves on

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE AND TOURIST
dialogues.text: The TOURIST has finally found the courage to speak. As he opens his mouth to make a sound, REGGIE, her eyes on DYLE rises quickly from the table and goes, leaving a very con TOURIST with his mouth open. He blinks, then leaves some  money on the table and starts after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE following DYLE. As she passes the GIRL painting, s cannot resist turning to see the work.

dialogues.speaker: PAINTING
dialogues.text: An abstract jumble, nothing recognizable.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: As she looks from the painting to reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the scene really looks.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: She shrugs, continues after DYLE. Now we see that the TOU in turn, is following her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Fraulein --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE doesn't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fraulein --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning but continuing) What are you doing, following me?  Stop it -- we're going to look like  a parade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues after DYLE. The TOURIST hesitates, then  continues after her.

dialogues.speaker: DYLE
dialogues.text: He goes to the curb and starts to step off, attempting to cross the Rue Danton, but finds the light against him. He turns back in REGGIE's direction.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: Realizing she has to do something before DYLE spots her, turns and takes the TOURIST's arm and starts walking with him back toward the cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling and rattling  on) How are you? When did you arrive in  town? Are you enjoying Paris? It's  lovely, isn't it? So many wonderful  things to see and do, it makes one's  head spin to think of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back over her shoulder and sees that DYLE is no crossing the Rue Danton, heading for the platform of a bu now stopped at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Fraulein --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE pulls away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't stop following me I'll  call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves him standing there, more confused than ever, a she starts after DYLE again. DYLE has hopped on the back of the bus as it pulls away. REGGIE hurries across the street, hailing a taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taxi -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE enters. CAMERA PANNING with him to the head of a sta leading downstairs, a sign indicating that it leads to th "MAIL ROOM & TELEPHONES." CAMERA PANS back to the doo REGGIE enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE walks to one of several windows. A sign over it read

dialogues.speaker: STAIRS
dialogues.text: REGGIE comes down the stairs. Suddenly she stops.

dialogues.speaker: DYLE
dialogues.text: CAMERA ZOOMS in to sign on "D."

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: A confused look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: DYLE
dialogues.text: As his turn comes, he addresses the CLERK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dyle, please... D - Y - L - E.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Dyle. I remember.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: Watching.

dialogues.speaker: MAIL WINDOW
dialogues.text: The CLERK takes out a bundle of letters and quickly sorts through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Dyle -- nothing today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks -- see you soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and heads out, starting up the stairs where REGG was but is no longer. As he reaches the fourth or fifth s a VOICE is heard over the loudspeaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dyle, please -- you're wanted on  the telephone -- Mr. Dyle. Cabin 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE stops in his tracks, pondering what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dyle. Cabin 4, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops and comes down the stairs, going to the back of room and into the cabin marked "4."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up the phone) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA DOLLIES across an empty cabin to discover REGGIE i the third one, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr. Dyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only name I've got. How  about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No cat and mouse -- you've got me.  What do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you lied to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to -- for all I knew you could  have been in on the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know now, so please tell  me who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know my name -- it's Dyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson Dyle is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he is. He was my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The army thinks he was killed in  action by the Germans, but I think  they did it -- Tex, Gideon and Scobie --  and your husband -- because he  wouldn't go along with their scheme  to steal the gold. I think he  threatened to turn them in and they  killed him. I'm trying to prove it.  They think I'm working with them.  But I'm not, and that's the truth.  I'm on your side, Reggie -- please  believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I? You lied to me -- the way  Charles did -- and after promising  you wouldn't. Oh, I want to believe  you, Peter... oh, but I can't call  you that anymore, can I? It will  take me a while to get used to your  new name -- which I don't even know  yet. What is it? (pause) Aren't you going to tell me? (pause) Hello -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door of the cabin and starts out.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE CABINS
dialogues.text: As REGGIE steps out of her cabin and starts looking in th others. They are all occupied except one and she looks in it.

dialogues.speaker: EMPTY CABIN
dialogues.text: The receiver hangs by its cord, swinging back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: As she looks at it, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE and SCOBIE stand together, waiting for the elevator, SCOBIE clearly holding a gun in the pocket of his raincoa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) If you do anything funny, or try to  talk to anyone, I'll kill you, Dyle --  here and now. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll wreck your raincoat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The self-service elevator doors open, one or two PASSENGE come out and DYLE and SCOBIE enter. A young GIRL starts i after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next car, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out and presses the top button with his metal  hand. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As SCOBIE follows DYLE out of the elevator. SCOBIE looks  around -- there is an open door at the end of a short hal He and DYLE go to it, CAMERA FOLLOWING. Through the door, which SCOBIE closes behind them, is a flight of stairs,  leading up to a second floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE turns to find SCOBIE's gun out of the pocket and poi at him. SCOBIE now transfers it to his metal hand and goe to DYLE, where he proceeds to frisk him. Finding the gun DYLE carries in his inside coat pocket, S removes it. During the following conversation he will sha open the revolving magazine and let the bullets fall out  onto the floor before handing back the emptied gun to DYL Then he will transfer his own gun back to his good hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrugging, DYLE sits on the third step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wait -- with our mouths shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last EMPLOYEES leave the building as the WATCHMAN loc the front door after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the semi-darkness, DYLE is still sitting on the third  step, SCOBIE still facing him with a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you intend -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said with the mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE yawns wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE gets to his feet and starts up the stairs, followed SCOBIE. DYLE stops at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I knock or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE opens the door. The stairs continue up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The view had better be worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spectacular view of the Paris rooftops and the city lig beyond. DYLE and SCOBIE come out onto a level portion of  roof. On the street side, the roof angles down abruptly i a steep, slate-covered pitch, broken only by two widely  separated oval-shaped dormer windows. Below these is a rain gutter, then nothing -- for seven  stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very pretty. Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a chance, Dyle -- which  is more than you'd give me. Where's  the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you dragged me all the  way up here -- to ask me that? She  has it -- you know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I say maybe you both have it!  One more time, Dyle -- where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supposing I did have it -- which I  don't -- do you really think I'd  hand it over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out, Dyle -- right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOBIE aims the gun and starts advancing toward DYLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE turns and looks -- there is nothing behind him but a sheer drop to the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving quickly, DYLE lashes out and hacks SCOBIE's gun ha with the side of his palm and the gun falls to the roof. Following through, DYLE punches the large man full in the jaw, but instead of falling, SCOBIE wraps his arm around  DYLE, holding on tightly until his head clears. Then, to his amazement, DYLE is lifted into the air and,  unable to break the bear-hold, carried toward the edge of the roof. Working his arms between their two bodies, DYLE suddenly flails them out with all his strength and the ho is broken, but at the price of his coat and the flesh on back as SCOBIE's metal claw rips through both, a wound  extending from the center of DYLE's back to his shoulder. Both men look around for the gun, spot it simultaneously leap for it, both landing short of the mark. Now they gra with one another, each trying to break free and reach for the gun.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR HANDS
dialogues.text: Two hands, one real, one metal, inch toward the gun.

dialogues.speaker: DYLE AND SCOBIE
dialogues.text: The battle is going to SCOBIE whose weight and strength a beginning to tire DYLE, who is now on his back, trying to stop SCOBIE from crawling over him. He has the large man both lapels of the raincoat in a last-ditch effort to hol him. But SCOBIE, his face horribly distorted from the str continues to inch forward toward the gun. Suddenly, DYLE releases his hold. With nothing restrainin him, SCOBIE lurches forward, tumbling past the gun, his  momentum carrying him onto the sloping part of the roof,  where he begins sliding down. SCOBIE beats wildly at the slate with his claw, trying to gouge a grip.

dialogues.speaker: SCOBIE'S CLAW
dialogues.text: As it slides across the slate, making a hideous scratchin sound and causing sparks to fly.

dialogues.speaker: SCOBIE
dialogues.text: As he slides over the edge and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: DYLE
dialogues.text: As he watches, hypnotized.

dialogues.speaker: ROOF EDGE
dialogues.text: There appears to be no sign of SCOBIE. Then CAMERA ZOOMS FOR A TIGHT CLOSE SHOT OF SCOBIE'S metal hand, gripping t rain gutter at the very edge.

dialogues.speaker: DYLE
dialogues.text: Having seen the claw, he rises and walks to the very edge the level part of the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herman?

dialogues.speaker: SCOBIE
dialogues.text: As he hangs, seven stories over the street, by his metal  hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DYLE
dialogues.text: He finds it hard to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you get bored, try writing 'Love  thy neighbor' a hundred times on the  side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE turns and leaves going down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOTEL MANAGER is busy taping a piece of cardboard ove the hole ripped in REGGIE's door by SCOBIE's metal hand t night before. DYLE leaves the elevator and goes to his ow door. The MANAGER eyes him coldly. DYLE "takes" the look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next time madame forgets her  key, there is another one at the  desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE smiles, then enters his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the door and starts to remove his torn coat,  wincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE, smoking on the bed, sits up when she hears DYLE m about in his room. She goes to the connecting door, unloc her side, tries the knob, finds it still bolted from his  side and knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE goes to the door, throws back the bolt and opens the door. REGGIE enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't anyone ever tell you it's  impolite to -- (seeing his injured  back) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met a man with sharp nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scobie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left him hanging around the American  Express.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- I've got something that  stings like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads him into her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE and DYLE enter from his room. She leads him to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off your shirt and lie down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE goes to the bathroom, DYLE takes off his torn s revealing a torn and bloody T-shirt. He lies face downwar on the bed. REGGIE returns, carrying cotton, gauze, tape, scissors, and disinfectant. She sits next to him and lift up his T-shirt to examine the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wincing) Listen -- all I really want is an  estimate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so bad. You may not be able  to lie on your back for a few days --  but, then, you can lie from any  position, can't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wets the cotton with disinfectant and begins cleaning the wound. He winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you got a bullet I can bite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues working on his back, cleaning it, then band it while they talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you really Carson Dyle's brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to see my passport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your passport! What kind of a proof  is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to see where I was  tattooed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll drive you around there  some day. (his back stinging) Ouch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha. You could at least tell me  what your first name is these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a Mrs. Dyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but we're divorced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that was Peter Joshua.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) I'm no easier to live with than he  was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing the bandage) There -- you're a new man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they continue talking, he rises from the bed and goes  into his own room. REGGIE remains on the bed, watching hi through the open door as he puts on a fresh T-shirt and s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I couldn't tell you the  truth, but I had to find out your  part in all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex -- how can you tell if someone  is lying or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be some way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an old riddle about two tribes  of Indians -- the Whitefeet always  tell the truth and the Blackfeet  always lie. So one day you meet an  Indian, you ask him if he's a truthful  Whitefoot or a lying Blackfoot? He  tells you he's a truthful Whitefoot,  but which one is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why couldn't you just look at his  feet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he's wearing moccasins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, then he's a truthful  Whitefoot, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not a lying Blackfoot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Which one are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (entering, smiling) Whitefoot, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it turns out you're a  Whitefoot, Alex -- I could be very  happy hanging around the tepee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- listen to me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-oh -- here it comes. The fatherly  talk. You forget I'm already a widow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So was Juliet -- at fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's your trouble right  there -- you're too old for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you be serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, you said it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serious. When a man gets to be my  age that's the last word he ever  wants to hear. I don't want to be  serious -- and I especially don't  want you to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- I'll tell you what -- we'll  just sit around all day long being  frivolous -- how about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts kissing him on the neck, on the chin, on the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now please, Reggie -- cut it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling back) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutting it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not through complaining yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (She starts kissing  him again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now please, Reggie -- cut it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I love you, Alex --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him on the mouth. The phone rings. He tries to talk as she continues kissing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling) The phone's ringing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever it is won't give up -- and  neither will I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone continues to ring and she continues to kiss him Finally, REGGIE reaches out to the bedstand and takes the phone off the hook. She brings the receiver up to their m and mumbles into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Sorry -- I was just -- uh -- nibbling  on something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEX speaks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miz Lampert, my buddies 'n me, we'd  oblige it mighty highly if you could  mosey on across the hall 'n chew the  fat with us for a spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE is watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Can you give me one good reason why  I should?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Yes, ma'am. A little one -- 'bout  seven or eight years old. Th' little  tyke keeps callin' you his Aunt Reggie --  ain't that cute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She covers the phone and turns to DYLE in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got Jean-Louis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds like their problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) I'll be right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) We'll be waitin' in room forty-seven,  Miz Lampert -- so you just wiggle on  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What day is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, I forgot all about it -- Sylvie  works late Tuesday nights -- she  always leaves him with me. They  wouldn't do anything to a little  boy, would they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -- it depends on whether  or not they've already eaten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT -- JEAN-LOUIS. He looks around, uncertainly, f one way, then the other. CAMERA PULLS BACK to show him si on SCOBIE's knee, the large man holding him with his good hand, the metal one in his pocket. TEX sits next to them  while GIDEON nervously paces the floor. When GIDEON begin sneezing he takes the small bottle of pills from his pock and downs one or two, swallowing some water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Tex -- move the kid to the other  knee or something, will you? My leg's  going to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEX lifts JEAN-LOUIS and puts him down on SCOBIE's other  knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upsy-daisy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a real cowboy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where is your gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking out his gun) Right here -- see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you put that thing away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK at the door. GIDEON goes to open it. REGGIE and D enter. She sees JEAN-LOUIS and TEX's gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Louis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snatches him off SCOBIE's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy, Miz Lampert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glaring at DYLE) Who invited you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Herman, it was a happy landing,  I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better call Sylvie -- she must  be frantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts for the door with JEAN-LOUIS. GIDEON blocks he way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that will have to wait,  Mrs. Lampert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But his mother --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She isn't going to be anybody's mother  unless you answer some questions. TEX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't no game,  Miz Lampert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcefully) Be quiet, all of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THREE MEN look at him, surprised by his tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And stop threatening that boy. He  doesn't have the money. Mrs. Lampert  doesn't either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Herman -- maybe you  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to TEX) Or you -- (to GIDEON) Or you -- GIDEON, TEX & SCOBIE (together) That's the most ridiculous -- ! You gone loco? Listen to the man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly. Suppose one of you found  Charles here in Paris, followed him,  cornered him on the train, threw him  out the window and took the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause) That's a crock! If one of us did  that he wouldn't hang around here  waiting for the other two to wise  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he'd have to. If he left he'd be  admitting his guilt -- and the others  would know what happened. Whoever it  is has to wait here, pretending to  look for the money, waiting for the  rest of us to give up and go home.  That's when he'll be safe and not a  minute before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause as the THREE MEN look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up till now we always figured she  had the money -- but you know so  much about it, maybe you've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what am I doing here? You didn't  know anything about me -- I'm the  only one who could have taken it and  kept right on going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just tryin' to throw us off!  They've got it, I tell you! Why don't  we search their rooms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exchanging looks  with REGGIE) It's all right with us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) What are we wastin' time for? Let's  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And while we're waiting, we might as  well go through yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping) Not my room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Herman -- have you got  something to hide? (a pause, then smiling) Then I take it there are no  objections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THREE MEN look at one another unhappily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd better exchange keys. Here's  mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes DYLE's key and gives DYLE his. GIDEON goes to RE takes her key and gives her his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine's in the door. Ariva durchy,  y'all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THREE MEN file out. DYLE and REGGIE exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- let's get busy. Who gets  your vote?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scobie -- he's the one that objected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing her the boy) He's all yours. I'll do Tex and  Gideon. Take Jean-Louis with you --  and make sure you bolt the door from  inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viens, Jean-Louis -- we're going to  have a treasure hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joining them) Oh, la! If I find the treasure, will  I win a prize?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to DYLE) What should we give him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about $25,000? Or do you think  it would spoil him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, takes JEAN-LOUIS' hand and leaves. DYLE turns survey TEX's room. He goes first to the drawer in the night table -- empty; the bed, looking in it and under it. Then he goes to the  desk and opens the drawers -- also empty. The bureau is n he opens all three double drawers and they, too, are  completely empty. Frowning, he goes to the armoire and op it -- shelves and hanging bar are likewise bare. Then, CAMERA PANNING DOWN, he sees the only thing he's fo so far in the room -- a pair of fine cowboy boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT -- AIRLINES BAG. CAMERA PULLS BACK to include  GIDEON, staring down at it as it lies on the table in the center of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes on the bag) Tex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including TEX, busy going through the bureau. He looks up then joins GIDEON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIDEON empties the contents of the bag on the table, then starts examining the various items. He opens the wallet.

dialogues.speaker: WALLET
dialogues.text: Inside, the initials "C.L." are printed in gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie's stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MED. SHOT -- TEX & GIDEON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mebbe we'd better call Herman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIDEON has put the wallet aside and now picks up the lett removing it from the envelope and reading it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? If it's not here, why bother  him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause) Why bother him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A broad grin from TEX. They continue going through the it from the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure nuthin's missin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The police have kindly provided  us with a list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEX takes the list, examines it, then folds it and puts i in his pocket. They finish with the items from the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There sure ain't nothin' here worth  no quarter of a million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless we're blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at GIDEON) You think that mebbe we're fishin'  the wrong stream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't s'pose one o' us has it,  like the man said -- I mean, that'd  be pretty distasteful -- us bein'  vet'rans o' the same war 'n' all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very sincerely) You know I'd tell you if I had it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nachurly. Jus' like I'd tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nachurly. And that goes for Herman,  too. TEX & GIDEON (together) Nachurly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TWO MEN look at one another, then smile -- then laugh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE on the phone, JEAN-LOUIS standing by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He's all right, Sylvie, honestly.  Just hurry up and get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and turns to JEAN-LOUIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, now -- if you wanted to  hide something, where would you put  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I would bury it in the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swell -- only this man doesn't have  a garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (Afterthought) Neither do I. (Seeing something) VoilГ !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VoilГ  what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Up there! I would put it up there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE looks to where JEAN-LOUIS is pointing -- to the to of the high armoire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know something, cookie? Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking one of the straight chairs to the armoire, she sta on it. Although she is still not high enough to see anyth by standing on tip-toes she is able to reach with her han over the top and grope around blindly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope I don't find any little hairy  things living up here -- wait! There  is something! If I can just -- yes,  I'm getting it -- a case of some  sort -- it's heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping up and down) I found it! I found it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think you're getting credit  for this, you're crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ecstatic) We won! We won!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE has finally managed to pull down the case -- a  rectangular black bag about the size and shape of a tromb case. As he climbs off the chair, JEAN-LOUIS suddenly run to the door, unbolts it and runs into the hall, CAMERA PA with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As JEAN-LOUIS runs out into the hall, shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found it! We found it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE is the first one to appear, coming out of GIDEON's r TEX has also appeared from REGGIE's room, followed by GID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THREE MEN rush by JEAN-LOUIS and squeeze simultaneous into SCOBIE's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As DYLE, TEX and GIDEON enter, REGGIE is placing the litt straight black chair to its original position. There is n sign of the black case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- ? Did you find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid said --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing atop the  armoire) Up there! It is up there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jean-Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEX grabs the chair and moves it to the armoire, climbing on it and grabbing the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing, I tell you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings it to the table as DYLE and GIDEON crowd around him, anxious to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ring of faces, one at a time. TEX, his jaw muscles wo feverishly; DYLE, his eyes unblinking, a slight smile on lips; GIDEON, his mouth open greedily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As TEX finally springs the latches and opens the lid.

dialogues.speaker: CASE
dialogues.text: Inside, neatly packed in velvet fittings, like the parts a musical instrument, are various portions of and attachm for a metal artificial hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumpin' frejoles -- it's Herman's  spare.

dialogues.speaker: THE THREE MEN
dialogues.text: As they stare at the case, surprised and just a little  embarrassed. Slowly TEX lowers the lid. The MEN avoid loo at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MEN look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (already running) He's in my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THREE MEN hurry past REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS and out of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE, TEX, and GIDEON, followed by REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS  cross the hall to DYLE's room. DYLE turns the key which i still in the door. He enters, followed by the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE, TEX and GIDEON stand in the center of the room, loo around. REGGIE and JEAN-LOUIS wait in the open doorway. T room looks like a cyclone hit the place, but there is no  sign of SCOBIE. The sound of running water can be heard c from behind the closed door to the bathroom and DYLE is t first to notice the water beginning to leak out from unde the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- you and the boy better  wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOBIE, still dressed in his raincoat, lies face up, his  head submerged in the filled tub, the water now pouring o the edge. His face is distorted. DYLE's hand appears and  turns off the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE, TEX and GIDEON staring at CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now who'da done a mean thing like  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking carefully at  both) I'm not quite sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considering the  situation) The police aren't going to like this  one bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helpful) We could dry him off and take him  down the hall to his own room. (looking at the body) He really doesn't look so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could put him to bed 'n let one  o' them fem-de-chambers find him in  the mornin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE and GIDEON look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor ol' Herman -- him 'n good luck  always was strangers. Maybe now he'll  meet up with his other hand someplace --  but I sure hope it ain't waitin' for  him in Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT -- SCOBIE. The dead man's eyes are open, his j hanging, his head lying crazily on the pillow. CAMERA PULLS BACK to show him lying in bed, dressed in hi pajamas. CAMERA WHIRLS for a TIGHT CLOSE SHOT of a MAID, eyes widening as the realization that the man is dead str her. Then she screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT -- GRANDPIERRE. The policeman is apoplectic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No! No! No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK to include, REGGIE, DYLE, TEX and GIDEO all sitting silently in the INSPECTOR's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man drowned in his bed --  impossible! And in his pajamas --  the second one in his pajamas --  c'est trop bГЄte! Stop lying to me -- (Tapping the side of  his nose) this nose tells me when you are lying -- it is never mistaken, not in twenty- three years -- this nose will make  me commissaire of police. (Tapping his fingers  on his desk) Mr. Dyle or Mr. Joshua -- which is  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yet you registered in Megeve as  Mr. Joshua. Do you know it is against  the law to register under an assumed  name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done in America all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRANDPIERRE raps for silence on his desk. During the paus he looks into each face in turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of you will be permitted to  leave Paris -- until this matter is  cleared up. Only I warn you -- I  will be watching. We use the  guillotine in this country -- I have  always suspected that the blade coming  down causes no more than a slight  tickling sensation on the back of  the neck. It is only a guess, of  course -- I hope none of you ever  finds out for certain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE and DYLE walking along the quai, next to the Seine CAMERA LEADING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think did it -- Gideon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or Tex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a big help. Can I have one of  those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have passed an ice-cream wagon on the corner of the  Pont au Double. DYLE shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the VENDOR) Vanille-chocolat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the following, the VENDOR makes a double-decker co and hands it to REGGIE. DYLE pays and they resume their w all with no break in the dialogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Tex did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I really suspect Gideon --  and it is always the person you don't  suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do women think it's feminine to be  so illogical -- or can't they help  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so illogical about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A) It's always the person you don't  suspect; B) that means you think  it's Tex because you really suspect  Gideon; therefore C) if you think  it's Tex, it has to be someone else --  Gideon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I guess they just can't help it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women. You know, I can't help feeling  rather sorry for Scobie. (a pause) Wouldn't it be nice if we were like  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- like Scobie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- Gene Kelly. Remember the way  he danced down there next to the  river in 'American in Paris' --  without a care in the world? This is  good, want some?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She offers him her cone, thrusting it forward with enough force to dislodge the ice-cream. It lands right next to h lapel, over his outside breast pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowning) I'd love some, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls open the pocket with two sticky fingers and look inside, then shakes his head sadly at what he sees. REGGI still holds the empty cone, not knowing what to do with i Seeing this, he takes it and sticks it into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sense messing up the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm not going to hit  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, about Scobie, I mean. I can't  think of any reason why he was killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They resume walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe somebody felt that four shares  were too many --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think that this  somebody will be satisfied with three?  He wants it all, Alex -- that means  we're in his way, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First your brother, then Charles,  now Scobie -- we've got to do  something! Any minute now we could  be assassinated! Would you do anything  like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) What? Assassinate somebody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including the Cathedral of NOTRE DAME in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- swing down from there on a rope  to save the woman you love -- like  Charles Laughton in 'The Hunchback  of Notre Dame'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE and DYLE step from the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up and change -- I'm starved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know what you want -- I'll  pick a suit that matches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes into his room and she goes into hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enters, fixes her hair in the mirror, then goes to th door connecting her room with DYLE's. She unlocks it, tri to open it, but finds it locked. Disappointed, she knocks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the house detective -- why  haven't you got a girl in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He calls to her through the closed door as he empties his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, you're a pest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to take a bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't it be better if you did it  in my room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't want to use that tub.  Besides, I don't want to be alone.  I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only next door -- if anything  happens, holler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down to take off his shoes, but is interrupted by the sound of REGGIE screaming. He races for the connectin door, pulls back the bolt and rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As DYLE enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wheels as the door is slammed and REGGIE, who had been standing behind it, locks it and pockets the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever hear the story of the  boy who cried wolf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shower's in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the door leading to the hall and finds that lo as well. She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warning) Reggie -- open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a ludicrous situation. There  must be dozens of men dying to use  my shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I suggest you call one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dare you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DYLE looks at her, then sits down and starts to remove hi shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (has she gone too  far?) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever heard of anyone taking  a shower with his shoes on? (to himself) What a nut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoes off, DYLE starts for the bathroom, humming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I usually sing a medley of old  favorites when I bathe -- any  requests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I know that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Testing the water with his hand, he now steps in fully  dressed. REGGIE can't believe her eyes. She goes to the o door for a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What on earth are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DYLE
dialogues.text: In the shower, making sure his suit gets uniformly soaked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (explaining pleasantly) Drip-dry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the soap and begins washing as if he were washin himself without the suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suit needs it more than I do,  anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How often do you go through this  little ritual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he takes out his handkerchief and rinses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day. The manufacturer recommends  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens his coat and reads a label inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wearing this suit during washing  will help protect its shape."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flicks a little water in her face, then takes the nail brush and scrubs his watch and watch-band. He holds up hi wrist so she can see the watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waterproof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins unbuttoning his suit. She turns and leaves, sla the door after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE goes to the armoire to select a dress. The PHON rings and she answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Mrs. Lampert? -- Bartholomew. I've  spoken to Washington, Mrs. Lampert --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Go ahead, Mr. Bartholomew -- I'm  listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) I told them what you said -- about  this man being Carson Dyle's brother.  I asked them what they knew about it  and they told me -- you're not gonna  like this, Mrs. Lampert -- they told  me Carson Dyle has no brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT -- REGGIE on the phone, looking like the rug h been pulled out from under her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause, quietly) Are you sure there's no mistake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) None whatsoever. Please, Mrs. Lampert --  be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE slowly lowers the phone to its cradle, a worried  expression on her face. Then the bathroom door opens and  DYLE appears dressed in a large bath towel. Her back is t him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left all my drip-dry dripping --  is it all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're probably weak from hunger.  You've only had five meals today.  Hurry up and we'll go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if we go someplace  crowded? I -- I feel like lots of  people tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large motor launch, moving along the river, gaily abl with lights.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE AND DYLE, (PROCESS)
dialogues.text: At a table for two by the rail, the city slowly passing i the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- you haven't spoken a word  in twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep thinking about Charles and  Scobie -- and the one who's going to  be next -- me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's going to happen to you  while I'm around -- I want you to  believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I believe it when you don't  even know who the killer is? I've  got that right, haven't I? You don't  know who did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then if we sit back and wait,  the field should start narrowing  down, shouldn't it? Whoever's left  alive at the end will pretty well  have sewn up the nomination, wouldn't  you say so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to say that I might  have killed Charles and Scobie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I have to do to satisfy you --  become the next victim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a start, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand you at all -- one  minute you're chasing me around the  shower room and the next you're  accusing me of murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carson Dyle didn't have a brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises from the table and walks away. DYLE hesitates a moment, then follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can explain if you'll just listen.  Will you listen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the river) I can't very well leave without a  pair of water wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Then get set for the story of  my life -- not that it would ever  make the best-seller list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiction or non-fiction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to listen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After I graduated college I was all  set to go into my father business.  Umbrella frames -- that's what he  made. It was a sensible business, I  suppose, but I didn't have the sense  to be interested in anything sensible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose all this is leading  somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It led me away from umbrella frames,  for one thing. But that left me  without any honest means of support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When a man has no profession except  the one he loathes, what's left? I  began looking for people with more  money than they'd ever need --  including some they'd barely miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (astonished) You mean, you're a thief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it isn't exactly the term I'd  have chosen, but I suppose it captures  the spirit of the thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't really blame you --  not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do believe it -- that's what I  don't believe. So it's goodbye  Alexander Dyle -- Welcome home Peter  Joshua.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, the name's Adam Canfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam Canfield. Wonderful. Do you  realize you've had three names in  the past two days? I don't even know  who I'm talking to any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now called ADAM) The man's the same, even if the name  isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- he's not the same. Alexander  Dyle was interested in clearing up  his brother's death. Adam Canfield  is a crook. And with all the  advantages you've got -- brains,  charm, education, a handsome face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- there has to be a darn good reason  for living the way you do. I want to  know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's simple. I like what I do -- I  enjoy doing it. There aren't many  men who love their work as much as I  do. Look around some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a Mrs. Canfield?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (together) -- we're divorced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Now go eat your dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk back to the table, where a WAITER is busy putti food on it, mostly on REGGIE's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (miserably) I could eat a horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at all the  food) I think that's what you ordered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you dare to be civil with me!   All this time you were leading me on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was I leading you on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that marvelous rejection -- you  knew I couldn't resist it. Now it  turns out you were only interested  in the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you like me to say --  that a pretty girl with an outrageous  manner means more to an old pro like  me than a quarter of a million  dollars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a toss-up, I can tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know I'm having a tough  time keeping my eyes off of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE reacts in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you should see your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking her hand,  nicely) It's lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him with happy amazement, then pushes her pl away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry -- isn't it glorious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Adam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right -- look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A searchlight near the boat's bridge has gone on and now  begins sweeping the river banks. On benches by the water' edge, lovers are surprised by the bright light which sudd and without warning discovers them in various attitudes o mutual affection. Some are embarrassed, some are amused a some (the most intimate) damn annoyed. One even shakes hi fist at the light.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE AND ADAM
dialogues.text: Who, like everyone else, leave the table and stand togeth at the rail watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look so bad in this light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
