dialogues.text: Why do you think I brought you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the lovers) I thought maybe you wanted me to see  the kind of work the competition was  turning out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty good, huh? I taught them  everything they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? Did they do that sort of thing  way back in your day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think I got here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises on tip-toes and kisses him gently; his only rea is to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you allowed to kiss back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The doctor said it would be bad  for my -- thermostat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him again. He responds a little better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you come on, you really come  on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to kiss him again, but he stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know why you're not taken -- no  one can catch up with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax -- you're gaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MED. SHOT -- GIDEON. As he sits bolt upright in bed, star The room is dark and the phone is ringing. He switches on the lamp, looks at the clock (it reads 3:30) and shakes h head before picking up the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? You must be crazy -- it's three- thirty in the morning -- you mean  now?  -- all right -- I'll be down  in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, swings his feet out of bed and spears his  slippers, reaching for his robe at the same time. Then he shuffles sleepily to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As GIDEON comes out of his room and goes to the elevator. The cage is there. He opens the door and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIDEON closes the sliding grill and presses a button. The cage starts down. GIDEON begins sneezing. Suddenly the  elevator stops between floors and the lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Turn on the lights!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as suddenly the lights go back on and the elevator s moving down again. GIDEON shakes his head and leans back, whistling again. The cage comes to his floor and starts p it. Seeing this, GIDEON looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NIGHT PORTER is asleep behind the desk. The elevator, GIDEON inside, keeps coming down. It passes the lobby lev and keeps right on going, toward the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! How do you stop this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator passes out of sight, still going down. There a silence as the motor stops, and then a series of sneeze that ends with a terrifying shriek. The NIGHT PORTER, rud awakened, runs to the elevator shaft, his shoes squeaking horribly. He looks up, sees nothing, then looks down. He  presses the call button and the motor starts. An instant later the cage appears and stops. The NIGHT PO opens the gate, pulls back the grill and the CAMERA RUSHE PAST him to pick up GIDEON. His body is sitting on the fl of the cage, its grotesque sprawling attitude resembling puppet's with its strings cut. Except that GIDEON has no  strings to cut -- only a throat. From ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT -- GRANDPIERRE. He is now doubly apoplectic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three of them -- all in their pajamas!  C'est ridicule! What is it, some new  American fad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal REGGIE and ADAM, in their  bathrobes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now your friend -- the one from  Texas -- he has disappeared -- checked  out -- pouf! into thin air! Where is  he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Mr. Dyle -- where were you  at three-thirty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my room, asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, Mrs. Lampert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Mr. Dyle's room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly) No -- in my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause, lighting cigar) It stands to reason you are telling  the truth -- for why would you invent  such a ridiculous story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE and ADAM exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I were you, I would not stay  in my pajamas. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRANDPIERRE turns and leaves. REGGIE and ADAM start down hall toward their own rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wraps it up -- Tex has the money.  Go back to bed -- I'll let you know  when I've found him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to look for him -- now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the police find him first they're  not very likely to turn over a quarter  of a million dollars to us, are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no time -- I'll call you in  the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM disappears into his own room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ADAM enters, going to the closet to remove his suit. The phone rings. He answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT -- TEX. As he speaks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Dyle, you listen to me -- my  mama didn't raise no stupid children.  I know who's got the money 'n I ain't  disappearing till I got my share --  'n' my share's growin' a whole lot  bigger ev'ry day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Where are you, ol' buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) (laughs) I'll tell you what, fella -- you  want t' find me, you jus' turn 'round -- from now on I'll be right behind  you. (hangs up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM, before hanging up, reflects on TEX's words, then lo behind him. Smiling softly, he hangs up the phone and sta for REGGIE's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE slips back into her robe and goes to the connectin door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She undoes the bolt and opens the door. ADAM enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we were wrong about Tex having  the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just heard from him -- he's still  hungry. That means killing Gideon  didn't get it for him -- so he's  narrowed it down to us. You've got  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've looked, Adam -- you know I have --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that airlines bag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, you're stubborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure am. Get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to the closet and gets the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles must have had the money with  him on the train, and Tex missed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the bag to the bed where he dumps out the conten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But everyone and his Aunt Lilian's  been through that bag. Somebody would  have seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's look anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, you're stubborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, it's there, Reggie. If only  we could see it. We're looking at it  right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something on that bed is worth a  quarter of a million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know -- I just don't know.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE AND ADAM
dialogues.text: As ADAM begins to examine the items one by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electric razor -- comb -- steamship  ticket -- fountain pen -- four  passports -- toothbrush -- wallet -- (He goes through the  wallet, finds nothing) key -- what about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the apartment -- it matches mine  perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The letter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes it out of the envelope and takes out his glasses before reading it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you don't really need those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her the glasses and she looks through them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need them. (She hands them back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the letter) It still doesn't make sense, but it  isn't worth any quarter of a million  either. Have we forgotten anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tooth powder. Wait a minute --  could you recognize heroin just by  tasting it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes some powder into his hand and tastes it. REGGIE watches expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heroin -- peppermint-flavored heroin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess that's it -- dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to bed. You've got to be at work  in the morning. There's nothing more  we can do tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) I love you, Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- last time I said "I love you,  Alex."

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The ultra-modern glass and concrete structure behind the  Ecole Militaire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL DELEGATES identified by little plaques in front o them listing their respective nations, and their AIDES, s around the large table. They are all wearing earphones. The ITALIAN DELEGATE is speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- di conseguenza, il Governo Italiano  ГЁ decisamente a favore per  l'incoraggiamento, in accordo con le  tradizioni etniche rispettive delle  culture basilari dei passi in via di  sviluppo. Per esempio, pregare i  Vietnamiti di aggiungere alle loro  risaie ed ai loro campi di soja  tradizionali una raccolta di semola,  non solo sconvolgerebbe le loro  secolari tradizioni ma, oltre tutto,  e questo ГЁ molto importante per il  Governo che io ho l'onore di  rappresentare disturberebbe  l'esportazione delle derrate farinose  italiane in questa parte del mondo.  Signori Delegati vi ringrazio della  vostra attenzione.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE, wearing her headset, is talking with SYLVIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope Jean-Louis understands about  last night -- it's just not safe for  him to be around me right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly -- he would not do  anything. He is not yet old enough  to be interested in girls. He says  collecting stamps is much more  satisfying to a man of his age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it -- Italy just finished.  They're recognizing Great Britain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh la vache!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYLVIE jumps up and rushes next door into her booth, shut the door after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BRITISH DELEGATE rises to speak, continuing through t next scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chairman, fellow delegates -- my  distinguished colleague from Italy.  Her Majesty's delegation has listened  with great patience to the Southern  European position on this problem,  and while we find it charmingly  stated, we cannot possibly agree  with its content. In 1937, in the  British colonies of Kenya, Uganda  and Tanganyika -- and, if I'm not  mistaken, more or less in Somaliland --  a programme of crop rotation was  instituted vis-Г -vis arable land  which had never before known the  plough, beginning before the soil  was able to know the sort of fatigue  now plaguing most of Western Europe.  In 1937, therefore, Her Majesty's  Government -- at that time His  Majesty's Government -- was able to  properly assay the situation. We  therefore oppose the resolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door from the hall opens and ADAM enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- I think I've found -- (stopping) are you on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's all right. What's wrong,  Adam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's wrong. I think I found  something. I was snooping around  Tex's room and I found this in the  waste basket. I've stuck it back  together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a paper.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE RECEIPT
dialogues.text: The one GRANDPIERRE gave REGGIE. It has been torn in half and scotch-taped back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the receipt Inspector Grandpierre  gave me -- for Charles's things. I  don't see how that's going to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't look. Last night, when we  went through the airlines bag,  something was missing. See -- ? (showing her the list) "One agenda." It wasn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I remember Grandpierre  looking through it. But there was  nothing in it -- at least, nothing  that the police thought was very  important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you remember anything at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpierre asked me about an  appointment Charles had -- on the  day he was killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With whom? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it only said where -- but I  can't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think, Reggie, you've got to think --  it may be what we're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That money's not ours, Adam -- if we  keep it, we'll be breaking the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense. We didn't steal it. There's  no law against stealing stolen money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course there is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is? Well, I can't say I think  very much of a silly law like that.  Think, Reggie -- please think --  what was written in Charles' notebook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- it was a place -- a street  corner, I think. But I don't -- (hearing something  through her earpiece) Hold it. I'm on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back to the conference, flips a switch and star speaking into her headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (translating) Mr. Chairman, fellow delegates -- my  distinguished colleague from Great  Britain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FRENCH DELEGATE is speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur le PrГ©sident, Messieurs les  dГ©lГ©guГ©s -- mon distinguГ© collГЁgue  de la Grande Bretagne -- le problГЁme  vu par mon Gouvernement n'est pas  aussi simple que nos amis les Anglais  voudraient nous le faire croire.  Mais leur pays n'est pas, aprГЁs tout,  un pays agricole, n'est-ce pas? La  position franГ§aise, ainsi que nous  l'avons soulignГ©e dans le rapport  numГ©ro trente-neuf bar oblique  cinquante-deux de la ConfГ©rence de  l'hГ©misphГЁre occidental qui a eu  lieu le 22 mars --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE is busy translating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as outlined in report number three- nine-stroke-five-two of the Western  Hemisphere Conference held on March  22 -- (she stops) no wait! It was last Thursday, five  o'clock at the Jardin des Champs- Г‰lysГ©es! Adam -- that was it! The  garden!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Thursday today -- and it's almost  five -- come on!

dialogues.speaker: CONFERENCE TABLE
dialogues.text: From REGGIE'S and ADAM'S ANGLE. All the DELEGATES and the AIDES suddenly turn, surprised, and look at CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: WINDOW
dialogues.text: From the DELEGATE'S ANGLE. Inside the booth, REGGIE and A can be seen heading for the door in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: CONFERENCE TABLE
dialogues.text: As the DELEGATES look at one another, confused.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE AND ADAM
dialogues.text: By the locked gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five o'clock -- Thursday -- the Garden --  it's got to be something around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Charles' appointment was last  week, not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but this is all we've got  left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're right there. Ten minutes  ago I had a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop grousing. If we find the money  I'll buy you an international  conference all your own. Now start  looking. You take this side and I'll  poke around over there.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THEY SEE
dialogues.text: A quick succession of shots showing: 1. Children's Merry-go-round 2. Rond Point de Champs-Elys with fountains playing 3. Children's swings 4. Restaurant Laurent 5. Balloon salesman

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM stands by the large fountain, staring off at somethi as REGGIE joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hopeless -- I don't even know  what we're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right -- I don't think Tex  does, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tex? You mean he's here, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: TEX
dialogues.text: He stands near the merry-go-round, looking at something i his hand: Charles' agenda. Now he closes it and moves off disappearing behind a hedge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better see what he's up to.   Stay here -- I won't be long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM starts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) Be careful, Adam -- please. He's  already killed three men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between the curb and the Jardin, several temporary wooden booths have been set up. They have collected quite a CROW Into this area comes TEX, followed at a safe distance by  ADAM. Suddenly TEX stops.

dialogues.speaker: TEX
dialogues.text: As he stares wide-eyed at something.

dialogues.speaker: STAMPS
dialogues.text: Neatly displayed on a counter of one of the booths.

dialogues.speaker: TEX
dialogues.text: As he wheels to look at another booth.

dialogues.speaker: MORE STAMPS
dialogues.text: In another arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: TEX
dialogues.text: He turns crazily to look at another booth, then another.

dialogues.speaker: EVEN MORE STAMPS
dialogues.text: Various FLASH SHOTS of stamps of all sizes, shapes and co

dialogues.speaker: TEX
dialogues.text: As he understands. He turns to rush off and bumps smack i ADAM. TEX is startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, fella --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes off past ADAM, who watches him for a moment,  confused, then turns toward the booth, not yet having see the stamps.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH
dialogues.text: From ADAM's angle. There are one or two persons standing the booth. CAMERA ZOOMS in on the display of stamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed) The letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly turns to find TEX.

dialogues.speaker: TEX
dialogues.text: As he hops into the back of a TAXI and it pulls away from the curb. ADAM runs toward another TAXI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taxi! -- Taxi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ADAM comes up the stairs and goes to REGGIE's door. Whipping out his gun, he flings open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From ADAM's angle. TEX sits in the armchair, staring at  CAMERA. Next to him is the airlines bag, its contents dum on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including ADAM as he enters, his gun trained on TEX. With speaking he goes to the airlines bag, then stoops down to through the spilled contents, keeping one eye all the tim on TEX. But he can't find what he's looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) All right -- where's the letter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The letter? The letter ain't worth  nuthin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean -- the envelope  with the stamps. I want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause, then  beginning to laugh) You greenhorn -- you half-witted,  thick-skulled, hare-brained,  greenhorn! They wuz both too smart  for us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First her husband, now her -- she  hoodwinked you! She batted all them  big eyes and you went 'n fell for it -  like a egg from a tall chicken!   Here! (holding out the  envelope) You want? Here -- it's yours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM takes it and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: ENVELOPE
dialogues.text: The corner containing the stamps is missing, torn off.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM AND TEX
dialogues.text: TEX sees the expression on ADAM's face and begins laughin hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you! Horn-swoggled by a purty  face 'n all them sweet words! You  killed all three of 'em for nothin'!   You greenhorn! You block-headed  jackass! You clod -- you booby --  you nincompoop -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE is looking around for ADAM. She sees something acr the street. CAMERA SPINS AROUND to discover SYLVIE, sitti alone on a bench near the stamp market, reading a newspap

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIE
dialogues.text: As REGGIE approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sylvie -- ? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) Hello, Reggie -- I am waiting for  Jean-Louis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) What's he up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was so excited -- when he got the  stamps you gave him this morning. He  said he had never seen any like them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad. But what's all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stamp market, of course -- it is  here every Thursday afternoon. This  is where Jean-Louis trades his --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as it dawns) Good Lord! The stamps! Where is he?  Sylvie -- we've got to find him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, chГ©rie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those stamps -- they're worth a  fortune!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping up) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fortune! Hurry -- we've got to  find him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rush off into the market.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE AND SYLVIE
dialogues.text: As they stop among the booths, looking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will separate -- you look over  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go off in opposite directions.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: As she hurries along a row of stalls, weaving around smal groups of MEN standing together, showing each other stamp

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIE
dialogues.text: Searching in another section of the market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Jean-Louis -- ?

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: Spotting a BOY, she runs to him and spins him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Louis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it isn't.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIE
dialogues.text: Looking everywhere. Suddenly she sees something.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP OF MEN
dialogues.text: Only a small boy's elbow and part of his arm show, the re hidden by all the legs.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIE
dialogues.text: She recognizes him from these fragments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Louis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes to him, CAMERA PANNING WITH HER. JEAN-LOUIS st looking at some stamps. SYLVIE grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Louis -- les timbrГ©s -- oГ№ sont- ils?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling, JEAN-LOUIS holds up an enormous sack of assorted stamps -- hundreds of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, zut! (calling) Reggie -- Reggie -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE runs up and joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Louis -- thank heavens! Do you  have -- ! (spotting the sack of  stamps) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man traded with me -- all those  for only four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no! What man, Jean-Louis --  where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN-LOUIS looks in one direction, then in the other, try to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vite, mon ange -- vite!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LГ  bas -- Monsieur FГ©lix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all run off down the line of booths. JEAN-LOUIS stop and points off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Il est lГ !

dialogues.speaker: STAMP BOOTH
dialogues.text: Closed, deserted, empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't blame him. Jean-Louis -- do  you know where this Monsieur FГ©lix  lives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- but I will ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the closest booth and shakes the coat sleeve o the proprietor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur ThГ©ophile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui, jeune homme?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur FГ©lix, oГ№ habite-il?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Montmartre -- demande Г  Monsieur  August au Bar des Artistes -- Place  Blanche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merci, Monsieur ThГ©ophile. (returning to REGGIE  and SYLVIE) He says to ask Monsieur August at  the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he can finish, SYLVIE, who has heard THГ‰OPHILE, h JEAN-LOUIS by the hand, dragging him off at full speed, R right alongside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bare, unkempt little room. FГ‰LIX, a man in his sixties sits at a table, smoking a pipe. There are stamps and alb everywhere. He holds a magnifying glass in his hand, busy studying something on the table. There is a KNOCK. He loo up. Another KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entrez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and REGGIE, followed by SYLVIE and JEAN-LO enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur FГ©lix -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking up) I was expecting you. You are American  too, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at SYLVIE) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man who bought them last week  was American. I did not see him but  I heard. I knew you would come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures for REGGIE to come closer. Together with SYLV and JEAN-LOUIS, she goes to the table and looks at the st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at them, Madame.

dialogues.speaker: STAMPS
dialogues.text: Four of them -- a red, a yellow, a blue, and a green, sti attached to the portion of the torn envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever, in your entire life,  seen anything so beautiful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm -- I'm sorry -- I don't know  anything about stamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know them as one knows his own  face, even though I have never seen  them. This yellow one -- a Swedish  four shilling -- called 'De Gula  Fyraskillingen' -- issued in 1854.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is it worth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money is unimportant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it is important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) In your money, perhaps $65,000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I sit down? (she sits) What about the blue one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is called 'The Hawaiian Blue' and  there are only seven left. In 1894  the owner of one was murdered by a  rival collector who was obsessed to  own it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's its value today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In human life? In greed? In suffering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty-five thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to SYLVIE) Do you have anything to eat? (to FГ‰LIX) And the orange one -- what about the  orange one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A two-penny Mauritius -- issued in  1856. Not so rare as the others --  $30,000 perhaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the last one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best for the last -- le chef- d'oeuvre de la collection. The  masterpiece. It is the most valuable  stamp in the world. It is called  'The Gazette Guyanne.' It was printed  by hand on colored paper in 1852 and  marked with the initials of the  printer. (looking at it through  the glass) Today it has a value of $100,000. (a pause) Eh, bien -- I am not a thief. I knew  there was some mistake. Take them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitating) You gave the boy quite a lot of stamps  in return, Monsieur FГ©lix -- are  they for sale now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the large  bag) Let me see. There are 350 European,  200 Asian, 175 American, 100 African  and twelve Princess Grace  commemorative -- which comes to nine  francs fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fishing money from  her purse) Here's ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FГ‰LIX goes to his wallet for the change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a tradesman, Madame, not a  doorman. And don't forget these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her the four stamps and her change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm -- I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. For a few minutes they were mine --  that is enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE comes hurrying up the stairs. She goes first to ADAM's room and knocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam? Adam? It's me, Reggie -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer. She goes to her own door and, to her  surprise, finds it an inch or two ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE enters. She freezes, having seen something on t floor.

dialogues.speaker: TEX
dialogues.text: His dead body lies on the floor, the wrists of his extend arms tied to the leg of the bed, his ankles to the steam  radiator. And tied around his head is a plastic, transpar bag, inside of which the suffocated man's face, the eyes  bulging against the plastic clinging tight to his feature can be seen all too clearly. REGGIE enters the shot, bend down to see if he's alive. Then she sees something beside his hands near the leg of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: CARPET
dialogues.text: With his dying effort, TEX has traced a name against the  grain of the maroon carpet -- 'DYLE.'

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: Astonished and horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) Dyle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she gets to her feet and hurries to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Hello -- Balzac 30-04, s'il vous  plait -- (waiting) Mr. Bartholomew! Thank God you're  there! Tex is dead, Mr. Bartholomew --  smothered -- and Adam did it -- he  killed them all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARTHOLOMEW, his face lathered for a shaving, is on the p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute, Mrs. Lampert -- you'd  better give that to me slowly. Who's  Adam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) The one who said he was Dyle's brother --  of course I'm sure -- Tex wrote the  word 'Dyle' before he died. He's the  murderer I tell you -- he's the only  one left! You've got to do something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Calm down, Mrs. Lampert -- please.  Does he have the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) No, I do -- it was the stamps on  that letter Charles had with him on  the train. They were in plain sight  all the time, but no one ever bothered  looking at the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) The envelope -- imagine that.  Mrs.  Lampert, listen to me -- you're not  safe as long as you've got these  stamps. Go to the Embassy right away --  wait, I'd better meet you halfway --  it's quicker. Now, let's see -- do  you know the center garden at the  Palais Royal? -- yes, by the colonnade --  as soon as you can get there. Hurry,  Mrs. Lampert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Yes, I'm leaving now -- goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up, looks briefly at TEX's body, shudders, then hurries to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE leaves her room and goes to the elevator. She  presses the button, then notices it is in use. She goes t the stairs and starts down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between the landings. The stairs curve around the open  elevator shaft. As REGGIE comes down the stairs, the cage rises into view. Inside is ADAM. For a moment, she stops their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- the stamps -- what've you  done with --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE starts running downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM pushes the emergency stop button and then starts the cage down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE comes off the stairs, passes the elevator gate starts down toward the lobby, the cage a few feet behind  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE continues to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between the first landing and the lobby. REGGIE running, elevator following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? So you can kill me too? Tex is  dead, I've seen him! He said Dyle  did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not Dyle -- you know that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Tex didn't -- he still thought --  !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be an idiot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE reaches the lobby first and, without hesitation, r toward the front door and out. The confused hotel MANAGER behind the desk can only stare in surprise. The elevator, ADAM inside, has not yet reached the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- ! I want those stamps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi stands by the curb. REGGIE leaves the hotel and ru to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the  direction) Palais Royal -- vite!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calmly, the DRIVER points to the little printed sign on h windshield reading "ITALIE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing the other  way) Porte d'Italie, moi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mais c'est trГЁs vite! On veut me  teur!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Italie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around and sees ADAM come out of the hotel and  straight toward her. She turns and runs off toward the Pl St. Michel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE comes to the corner. She stops, sees the MГ©tro station ("St. Michel") and rushes to it, scampering down stairs. ADAM is behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE comes flying down the stairs and runs past the tic booth, fishing in her bag for her carnet (booklet of tick casting a quick look behind her. CAMERA PANS QUICKLY TO A just coming off the stairs, who runs after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE gets to the gate ahead of ADAM and manages to crow in front of some OTHERS about to pass through. Barely  stopping, she holds out her ticket to the GUARD to be pun then heads down the platform, still running. ADAM gets to the gate but the GUARD stops him as he tries to pass thro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billet, Monsieur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) I don't want to go anywhere -- I'm  only trying --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing off) Billet, Monsieur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM tries to look past him, to see REGGIE, but gives it and goes back toward the ticket booth, on the run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA LEADING REGGIE as she runs -- the passageway is ne empty. Her footsteps echo against the tile and concrete w

dialogues.speaker: PASSAGEWAY WALL, (TRAVELING)
dialogues.text: The jumble of advertising posters as it passes rapidly,  forming a moving band of letters, women, cartoons and col

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE stops and pauses for a moment at a sign indicating two different directions, an arrow for each. "DIRECTION: Pte D'ORLГ‰ANS Pte DE CLIGNANCOURT-------" Choosing "Clignancourt," she runs off. CAMERA PANS SHARPL 180 degrees, to pick up ADAM rounding the corner in hot  pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE starts down the platform, looking behind her every few steps.  Suddenly she looks up in surprise -- there, a the tracks on the opposite platform is ADAM.  He has evid made the wrong turn back in the passageway. They stare at each other for a moment.  Then the bell rin announcing the arrival of a train. ADAM turns, running ba through the exit behind him. Not knowing what to do, REGG looks into the darkness of the tunnel. The approaching tr can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself) Come on -- please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to look at the gate -- slowly, the pneumatic do starts to close. As it does, the train roars into the sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gate can be seen slowly closing. ADAM runs to it, tri to force it back but cannot. Finally, he jumps up and,  commando style, vaults over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE is just entering the red center car (the two on ei side are dark green). ADAM runs for the red car and just  manages to make it as the doors shut in unison, the latch falling with a concerted click and the little whistle blo to inform the motor-man to depart. The train starts to mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire length of the car separates ADAM and REGGIE. For a moment, their eyes meet, then ADAM starts to weave way past the other PASSENGERS, on his way to her. Suddenly, he is stopped. ADAM turns to see a TRAIN GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billet, Monsieur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM shows him his yellow ticket and starts past him, but again the TRAIN GUARD stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vous ГЄtes dans le premier classe,  Monsieur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavy accent) This car is for first class only --  you have a second-class ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's what they gave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to pull away from the TRAIN GUARD and finds hims staring into the serious face of a GENDARME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM looks at the GENDARME, then at REGGIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the TRAIN pulls in and comes to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GENDARME opens the door for ADAM and escorts him out. ADAM turns once more to look at REGGIE as he goes. She re in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GENDARME gestures for ADAM to enter the green, second class car behind the red, first-class one. Reluctantly, A does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ADAM enters and goes to the door through which he can REGGIE in the car ahead. She is gone. Moving quickly, he  returns to the exit door and looks at the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From ADAM'S P.O.V. She is hurrying toward an exit marked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Featuring ADAM as he hurries from the car. He finds his w blocked by FIVE NUNS in large, white butterfly hats. It takes him a few precious seconds to work his way aroun them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE has entered an area leading to the exit. But as sh reaches the stairway leading up to the street level, she confronted with an iron grill barring her way. She tries open it, but it is firmly padlocked. A sign hung on it re "FERMГ‰ LES WEEKENDS." She turns, desperately looking for some way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM is off the train. He stands on the platform as the t doors slam shut, the latches click, the whistle blows and the train pulls out. He looks around in all directions,  looking for some sign of REGGIE. He spots the exit marked "SORTIE" (the same one used by REGGIE) and starts toward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As ADAM enters the deserted area. There is, miraculously, sign of REGGIE. He goes to the locked grill and tries it, testing the padlock. CAMERA PANS to a phone booth (solid  door with a window in the upper half) and we see REGGIE's hand reaching up to dial a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE sits on the floor of the booth, dialing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself, as she  dials) Balzac 3 - 0 - 0 - 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds the receiver to her ear. The number can be hear ringing but no one answers. She hangs up and reaches for phone book, leafing through its pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embassies -- embassies --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM stands for a minute, looking around, not knowing wha to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE has finished dialing her number and now pushes the button. It clicks loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. (into the phone,  whispering) American Embassy? Mr. Bartholomew's  office, please -- Mr. Bartholomew's  office --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OPERATOR speaking into a headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you speak out, please? I can't  quite hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) No, I can't speak any louder --  Hamilton Bartholomew -- B as in --  uh -- Bartholomew -- that's right,  and the rest as in Bartholomew!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) I'm sorry, but Mr. Bartholomew has  left for the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) But someone's trying to kill me --  you've got to send word to him -- in  the center garden of the Palais Royal,  by the colonnade -- tell him I'm  trapped in a phone booth, below him  in the MГ©tro station. And my name's  Lampert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) All right, Mrs. Lampert -- I'll see  what I can do. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unplugs the call, plugs in another one and dials quic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Bartholomew? -- there was  a call for you just now, Mr.  Bartholomew -- it sounded quite urgent --  a Mrs. Lampert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a man we've never seen before, the physical opposit of the old BARTHOLOMEW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lampert? I don't know any Mrs. Lampert --  trapped in a MГ©tro station? Who does  she think I am, the C.I.A.? All right,  you'd better call the French police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MED. SHOT -- PHONE BOOTH. As REGGIE's head appears, peeki cautiously over the bottom of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From inside the phone booth. Through the glass ADAM can b seen, leaving the Sortie area.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE BOOTH
dialogues.text: Carefully, REGGIE opens the door and comes out. She goes the corner and looks around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From REGGIE'S P.O.V. as ADAM walks away from CAMERA, down the platform. CAMERA PANS TO REGGIE, peeking around the  corner. She looks the opposite way, sees another exit at other end of the platform (also marked "SORTIE"). She loo back once more at ADAM, then makes up her mind and starts running towards the exit.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: As the bell rings announcing the next train. He turns to  look and sees REGGIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) Reggie -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes off, running after her.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: As she runs, ADAM several yards behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in b.g., calling) Reggie -- wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns into the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE starts up the long, steep flight of stone steps leading to the street level. ADAM appears behind her, cli two at a time and gaining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- why won't you listen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm through listening to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is rapidly closing the gap between them. It is clear t REGGIE is tiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't kill anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who did? You're the only one  left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PASSERSBY, descending the stairs, stand aside to let the strange Americans pass, watching in wonderment. ADAM is o a few steps behind now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- please believe me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE wearily gains the top, ADAM lunges for her. He  manages to grab her foot as he falls forward, but all he  winds up with is a shoe which has come loose in his hand. REGGIE shrieks, then regaining her balance, continues run limping in her one shoe. ADAM scrambles to his feet and s after her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE, still hobbling, runs through and toward the st leading to the street. CAMERA PANS TO ADAM, as he, too, r through. He is again several yards behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE comes up the stairs from the MГ©tro. She stops enough to kick off her other shoe, then runs across the  street, ignoring the traffic, toward the Rue de Valois (w forms one side of the Palais Royal). ADAM is gaining on h again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smaller court at the ComГ©die-FranГ§aise end of the P gardens, separated from the larger garden by a double  peristyle consisting of two twin rows (these separated fr each other by a small marble court) of twenty columns eac in all, eighty columns. The only person in sight is the m we have known as BARTHOLOMEW, waiting at the far end of t columns, looking at his watch impatiently. Then, from the Rue de Valois side of the Palais, REGGIE r into the court. She spots "BARTHOLOMEW" and fishes in her bag for the stamps as she runs, taking them out and wavin them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bartholomew -- he's chasing me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM has run into the court and now skids to a stop at th near end of the colonnade as he spots "BARTHOLOMEW." REGG still running, is halfway between the two men. "BARTHOLOM draws his gun but can't get a shot at ADAM, who has ducke in among the columns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- stop! That's Carson Dyle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This news hits REGGIE hard and she stops, in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) Carson -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at "BARTHOLOMEW," then back at ADAM, who has dr his own gun. (NOTE: Both "BARTHOLOMEW" and ADAM are in among the stone columns at opposite ends of the colonnade, keeping out of each other's sight. REGGIE stands out in the open, the st in her hand, confused as to which man she should go to).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) We all know Carson Dyle is dead,  Mrs. Lampert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Carson Dyle, I tell you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to believe him,  Mrs. Lampert -- it's too fantastic.  He's trying to trick you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE looks at one, then the other, not knowing what to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tex recognized him -- that's why he  said Dyle. If you give him those  stamps, he'll kill you too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE takes a step toward ADAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Lampert -- if I'm who he said,  what's preventing me from killing  you right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE stops, turns back to "BARTHOLOMEW."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he'd have to come out to get  the stamps -- he knows he'd never  make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you, Mrs.  Lampert? Are you going to believe  every lie he tells you? He wants the  money for himself -- that's all he's  ever wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ADAM, explaining) He's -- with the C.I.A. -- I've seen  him at the Embassy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a fool! He's Carson Dyle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Mrs. Lampert -- I'm a  dead man -- look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who anybody is any more!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- listen to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to me so many times --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Reggie -- trust me once more --  please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I really believe you this time,  Adam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause) There's not a reason on earth why  you should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks toward ADAM for a moment, then back to  "BARTHOLOMEW", then slowly starts toward ADAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop right now, Mrs. Lampert, or  I'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE stops in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't get you the stamps, Dyle --  You'll have to come out to get them,  and I'm not likely to miss at this  range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now called CARSON) Maybe not -- but it takes a lot of  bullets to kill me. They left me  there with five of them in my legs  and my stomach -- they knew I was  still alive but they left me. I spent  ten months in a German camp -- with  nothing to stop the pain and no food --  they were willing to take all these  chances for the money, but not for  me. They deserved to die!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: During the following, he looks around, looking for some w out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't have anything to do  with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got the money. It belongs to  me now! Please believe me, Mrs.  Lampert -- I'll kill you -- a little  more blood won't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During this ADAM has moved out from behind the columns,  creeping cautiously across the open space between the two colonnades and finally, behind the second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you five to make up your  mind, Mrs. Lampert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has seen ADAM's move from her angle, but doesn't know quite what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, please! I need some time to  think!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One --

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: As he slowly moves along behind the second colonnade, his gun ready, trying to get an angle on CARSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- two --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly ADAM stops -- he has caught sight of CARSON thro the columns. But he will have a difficult shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- three --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- four --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS DOWN to his gun. As his finger tightens on th trigger and the hammer moves slowly back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam -- please!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: As he aims carefully and fires.

dialogues.speaker: COLUMN
dialogues.text: As the bullet creases it.

dialogues.speaker: CARSON
dialogues.text: As the deflected bullet rips the shoulder of his coat, le him unharmed. He wheels.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: With CARSON in the b.g., who fires at him. ADAM ducks beh the column as the bullet hits it and screams off. Quickly, he peers back out and throws another shot.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: Seeing CARSON otherwise occupied, she turns and runs towa the open stage door of the ComГ©die FranГ§aise behind her (Beside the door is a poster announcing the forthcoming  schedule of presentations.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including CARSON who, seeing REGGIE running to the door,  turns and fires at her. But he is too late -- she is safe inside. CARSON looks quickly back toward ADAM, then takes off after REGGIE.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Over his shoulder we see a broken picture of CARSON runni toward the theatre door, flashing by the near and far col ADAM tries to get a shot at him, but can't. Finally he runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As CARSON enters and slams the door behind him, locking i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM arriving at the door, bangs on it, then looks around frustrated. Several yards away he sees a short stairway  leading down to a door below the street level. He runs to it, tries the door and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As CARSON enters the auditorium and looks around. CARSON'S P.O.V. As the CAMERA SWEEPS the magnificent old theatre -- boxes seats, stage, but there is no sign of REGGIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As CARSON walks up the aisle checking between the rows of seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large room, lit by a single bare bulb, under the stage. ADAM appears, moving cautiously, gun ready. He creeps alo next to the wall, looking around at all the various sceni pieces which fill the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As CARSON moves carefully across the darkened stage near footlights, looking for REGGIE. At mid-stage, CAMERA PANS DOWN to his feet, only a few inches from the prompter's b Inside, huddling down, is a terrified REGGIE, holding her breath as she watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As CARSON moves into the opposite wings, sees the light b and throws on all the switches. The stage is bathed in li He returns to the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM is looking up, having heard the footsteps on the sta over his head -- and hearing them now. He looks around an sees a narrow, curving staircase leading up. He goes to i and, starting up, finds a door. He tries the knob -- the  door is locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE, cringing back from the bright light, notices the  doorknob turning. It makes a slight clicking sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARSON, upstage, looking behind a piece of classic scener hears the doorknob and turns suddenly. CARSON'S P.O.V. We catch a quick glimpse of REGGIE as she ducks down out sight.  Too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Mrs. Lampert. The game's  over. Come out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE does not appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to kill you, Mrs. Lampert -- but I will --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM comes down the stairs from the prompter's box and lo up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: CEILING
dialogues.text: It is divided into thirty-six square sections, each numbe and lettered -- from 1A to 6F. They are trapdoors.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: He looks from the ceiling to a row of levers on one wall.

dialogues.speaker: LEVERS
dialogues.text: Thirty-six of them, numbered and lettered to correspond t the traps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As CARSON takes a few steps towards the prompter's box, h gun ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear me, Mrs. Lampert -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE huddled inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM is listening carefully, trying to figure out where C is standing, watching the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: TRAP
dialogues.text: It is marked C-4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't wait much longer, Mrs. Lampert

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: As he turns to the levers and reaches for the one marked 4. He is about to pull it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARSON takes a few more steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM stops himself from pulling the lever just in time. H lets his held breath escape. He looks back at the ceiling

dialogues.speaker: TRAP
dialogues.text: The one marked C-4. As CARSON's voice is heard, CAMERA MO to the next trap, marked D-4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're in there, Mrs. Lampert --

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: He looks at the lever marked D-4. He is perspiring heavil Now he slowly reaches for the lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARSON is about to move closer to the prompter's box when suddenly the stage under him opens and he plummets throug out of sight. At the same time we hear a shot.

dialogues.speaker: PROMPTER'S BOX
dialogues.text: As REGGIE slowly peers out. REGGIE'S P.O.V. The empty stage, without being able to see the open trap  from this low angle.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: As she climbs out of the booth and, seeing the open trap  now, runs to it, looking down through it.

dialogues.speaker: OPEN TRAP
dialogues.text: FROM ABOVE, over REGGIE's head. She can see CARSON sprawl on the floor below, face down and dead. ADAM stands besid the body, looking up at REGGIE and smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As GRANDPIERRE and his TWO ASSISTANTS, guns drawn, walk o the stage from the wings. They go to the open trap and lo down at ADAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Dyle -- you are under arrest for  the murders of Charles Lampert, Herman  Scobie, Joseph Penthollow, Leopold  Gideon, and whoever that is down  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM is surprised, then shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- you'd better tell him. He  wouldn't dare hit a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a TAXI rolls by the arcades, CAMERA PANNING with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE and ADAM in the rear of the cab. REGGIE has one of her feet in her hand, shoe off, rubbing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have to chase me so hard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, give it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to take the foot but she pulls it back and offe him the other one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one's done -- start on this  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the foot and begins rubbing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I thought you were the  murderer, Adam -- how did I know  that he was as big a liar as you  are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's all the gratitude I get  for saving your hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth, now -- was it my hide --  or the stamps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a terrible thing to say. How  could you even think that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, prove it to me -- tell me  to go to the Embassy first thing in  the morning and turn in those stamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, tell me to go to the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you, I heard you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reggie -- listen to me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind -- I'll go by myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think they're even  interested? It's only a quarter of a  million -- it'll cost more than that  to fix up their bookkeeping. As a  taxpayer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As REGGIE and ADAM approach the MARINE in full-dress unif always on guard at the Embassy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ADAM) Who's a taxpayer? Crooks don't pay taxes.  Excuse me, soldier --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marine, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me. Whom would I see regarding  the return of stolen Government money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might try the Treasury Department,  ma'am -- Room 216, second floor, Mr.  Cruikshank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruikshank, 216. Thank you, Marine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Featuring a door marked "216." REGGIE and ADAM appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I wait out here? The  sight of all that money being given  away might make me break out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SECRETARY sits behind a desk. She looks up as REGGIE en

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Cruikshank, please -- my name is  Lampert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SECRETARY picks up her phone and presses a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Cruikshank, a Miss --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a Mrs. Lampert to see you -- yes  sir. (to REGGIE) Go right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REGGIE goes to the door leading to the private office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Featuring the door as REGGIE enters. She stops suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Featuring the desk. Behind it sits ADAM (now CRUIKSHANK). REGGIE stares at him, unbelievingly, then looks around,  confused. By way of explanation he indicates the door to hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blowing up) Well, of all the mean, rotten,  contemptible, crooked --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crooked? I should think you'd be  glad to find out I wasn't crooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't even be honest about  being dishonest. Why didn't you say  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not allowed to tell. May I  have the stamps, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching into her  bag) Here -- (hesitating) Wait a minute -- how did Carson Dyle  get an office in here, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you see him -- what time, I  mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lunch hour. He probably worked  it out in advance. He found an office  that was usually left open and just  moved in for the time you were here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how do I know this is your  office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up the phone) Mrs. Foster -- send a memo to  Bartholomew at Security recommending  that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartholomew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- recommending that all Embassy  offices be locked during the lunch  hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting with his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hanging up) Okay, now -- hand over those stamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your first name today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian Cruikshank -- it would serve  me right if I got stuck with that  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who asked you to get stuck with any  of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a Mrs. Cruikshank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're -- divorced?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crestfallen) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother -- she lives in Detroit.  Come on now -- give me those stamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you can prove to me that  you're really Brian Cruikshank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about if next week some time I  put it on a marriage license -- that  ought to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit stalling -- I want to see some  identification -- now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't lie on a thing like that --  I could go to jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd lie about anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe we'd better forget about  it, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't prove it, can you? You're  still trying to -- (the coin drops into  the slot) marriage license! Did you say -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say anything. Will you give  me those stamps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did too say it -- I heard you.   Oh, I love you Adam -- I mean Alex --  er, Peter -- Brian. I hope we have  lots of boys -- we can name them all  after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we start on that, do you mind  handing over the stamps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONUS ITEM -- Lyrics to the theme song of the film:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music by Henry Mancini, Words by Johnny Mercer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we played our Charade we were like children posing,  Playing at games, acting out names, guessing the parts we played. Oh, what a hit we made. We came on next to closing Best o the bill, lovers until love left the masquerade. Fate seemed to pull the strings, I turned and you were go While from the darkened wings the music box played on. Sad little serenade, song of my heart's composing, I hear still, I always will, best on the bill Charade.
